data.name: NumberingLevel
desc: These properties describe the numbering of a paragraph.
NumberType determines the type of the numbering symbol. Depending on this setting, some of the following values will be ignored.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

properties.name: BulletFontName
desc: This is the name of the font that is used for the bullet.

properties.name: BulletId
desc: The bullet symbol with this code in the assigned font is used.

properties.name: CharStyleName
desc: This is the name of the character style that is used for the symbol(s).

properties.name: GraphicBitmap
desc: This is the graphic bitmap to use as a symbol.
**since**
LibreOffice 6.1

properties.name: GraphicURL
desc: This is the URL of a graphic file to use as a symbol.

Note the new behaviour since it this was deprecated: This property can only be set and only external URLs are supported (no more vnd.sun.star.GraphicObject scheme). When an URL is set, then it will load the graphic and set the GraphicBitmap property.

properties.name: ListFormat
desc: Format string used to generate actual numbering.
It contains placeholders (like %1%, %2%, etc) where corresponding level numberings are inserted.
This is more flexible way to provide multilevel numbering with complex format string. This property is a replacement for Prefix and Suffix: if ListFormat is provided, they are not used anymore.
Example: ListFormat \"(%1% %2%.%3%)\" can be resolved to numbering in actual multilevel list like \"(4 1.3)\".
**since**
LibreOffice 7.2

properties.name: NumberingType
desc: specifies the type of numbering.

properties.name: ParentNumbering
desc: specifies the number of higher numbering levels that are included in the representation of the current number.

properties.name: Prefix
desc: This prefix is inserted in front of the numbering symbol(s).

properties.name: StartWith
desc: This specifies the start value for the numbering.

properties.name: Suffix
desc: This suffix is inserted after the numbering symbol(s).
